actionConfiguration.body:
SELECT
  DATE_FORMAT(last_day, '%Y-%m') AS month,
  COUNT(DISTINCT subscriptions.id) AS subscriptions,
  ROUND( SUM( subscriptions.recurring_amount / 12 ), 2 ) as mrr
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      DISTINCT id,
      status,
			recurring_amount,
			expiration
    FROM
      wp_edd_subscriptions
		WHERE
      status = 'cancelled'
			AND notes NOT LIKE '%cancelled by gateway%'
  ) AS subscriptions
  JOIN (
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(NOW()) AS last_day
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 1 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 2 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 3 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 4 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 5 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 6 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 7 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 8 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 9 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 10 MONTH))
    UNION ALL
    SELECT
      LAST_DAY(DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 11 MONTH))
  ) AS months
ON
  (subscriptions.expiration > DATE_SUB(months.last_day, INTERVAL 1 MONTH) AND
  (subscriptions.expiration <= months.last_day))
GROUP BY
  month;
